724847f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 59th Street (East)
724847f-a.text:
York Ave., west side, north from, but not including East 59th Street,
as seen from under the Queensboro Briige.
December 6, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

724848f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 59th Street
724848f-a.text:
York Avenue (Avenue A), north from 59th Street. TChe dark body overhead is Queensboro Bridge.
on the west side, from o0th to 6lst Streets, is a garage built since 1920. The gas tanks are in the two blocks olst to b2nd and o2nd to 63rd Streets; opposite the sccond one, on the N.E. corner of 62nd Street, is the pumping station and tower of the Consolidated Gas Company. Behind and to the right of these may be seen the malting plant of George Ehret, east of York Avenue between 63rd and o4th Streets; it will be demolished in October 1930. Demolition of buildings on the east side of the Avenue, from o8th to 71st
Streets, has not yet taken place.
At the time of this picture the name of the Avenue, north from this point, is about to be changed to York Avenue. The old Avenue A
house numbers will still be used after the change.
March 5. 1928.
New York Edison Company Collection.

724849f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 59th Street (East)
724849f-a.text:
York Avenue, north from East 59th Street, showing the East River Drive construction activity at the Cueensboro Bridge (overhead). This necessitated a fill to enable same to continue on Marie Curie Avenue (formerly Exterior or Marginal Street). The dark buildings beyond are units of the Rockefeller Research Institute. These preceed the white buildings constituting the New York Hospital and Cornell Medical Center. Incidentally the hill covers several blocks and View 1 is from 59th Street, View 2
from 60th Street, and View 3 from 61st Street.
August 1, 1939
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

724850f-a.title: Manhattan: York Avenue - 59th Street (East)
724850f-a.text:
York Avenue, north from East 59th Street, showing mainly the easterly side, paralleling the East River. beyond the power house stacks are the white buildings of the New York Hospital and Cornell Medical College. The dark structures to the right form the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research. Beyond appears the arched Hellgate Bridge. Note the new East River Drive skirting the river's edge. Overhead is the Cueensboro Bridge.
May 12, 1940
Gift of George Jiranek
Photostat Division
New York Public Library
